info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 2:09AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM EDT... At 208 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Bethlehem, or near Rimersburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarion, Brookville, Knox, Rimersburg, East Brady, Parker, Sligo, Emlenton, Strattanville, Summerville, Limestone, and Shippenville. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 45 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
